content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A vehicle manufacturer has built a self-driving vehicle that uses video camera inputs to help steer the vehicle. The manufacturer plans to investigate the performance of three different software programs (A, B, and C) that distinguish video of a vehicle remaining in its lane from video of a vehicle drifting from its lane. The manufacturer selected a random sample of <math alttext="450" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>450</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> video clips from a large database of clips that depict a vehicle remaining in its lane. Each video clip was randomly assigned to one of the three software programs. The table shows the number of video clips correctly classified as the vehicle remaining in its lane and incorrectly classified as the vehicle drifting from its lane for each software program. REMAINING-IN-LANE VIDEO CLIPS Software A Software B Software C Total Correctly classified vehicle as remaining in its lane <math alttext="145" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>145</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="112" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>112</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="101" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>101</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="358" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>358</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Incorrectly classified vehicle as drifting from its lane <math alttext="17" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="26" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>26</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="49" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="92" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>92</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Total <math alttext="162" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>162</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="138" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>138</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="150" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="450" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>450</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (a) Compare the relative frequencies of vehicles correctly classified as remaining in their lane for each software program to determine which is highest.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A vehicle manufacturer has built a self-driving vehicle that uses video camera inputs to help steer the vehicle. The manufacturer plans to investigate the performance of three different software programs (A, B, and C) that distinguish video of a vehicle remaining in its lane from video of a vehicle drifting from its lane. The manufacturer selected a random sample of <math alttext="450" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>450</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> video clips from a large database of clips that depict a vehicle remaining in its lane. Each video clip was randomly assigned to one of the three software programs. The table shows the number of video clips correctly classified as the vehicle remaining in its lane and incorrectly classified as the vehicle drifting from its lane for each software program. REMAINING-IN-LANE VIDEO CLIPS Software A Software B Software C Total Correctly classified vehicle as remaining in its lane <math alttext="145" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>145</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="112" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>112</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="101" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>101</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="358" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>358</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Incorrectly classified vehicle as drifting from its lane <math alttext="17" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="26" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>26</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="49" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="92" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>92</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Total <math alttext="162" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>162</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="138" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>138</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="150" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="450" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>450</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (a) Compare the relative frequencies of vehicles correctly classified as remaining in their lane for each software program to determine which is highest.

The manufacturer selected a second random sample of <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> video clips from a large database of clips that depict a vehicle drifting from its lane. Each video clip was randomly assigned to one of the three software programs. The segmented bar graph shows the distribution of the number of video clips correctly classified as the vehicle drifting from its lane and incorrectly classified as the vehicle remaining in its lane for each software program. (b) Write a few sentences describing what the graph reveals about the association between software program and classification accuracy among the <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> video clips depicting a vehicle drifting from its lane.
(c) For each software program, give a statistical reason why the manufacturer might choose to use the software program for its self-driving vehicle. Do not perform an inferential procedure.

The manufacturer plans to use the sample data to investigate whether there is convincing statistical evidence, at <math alttext="alpha equals 0.01" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, that the proportion of remaining-in-lane video clips that would be correctly classified by Software B is less than the proportion of drifting-from-lane video clips that would be correctly classified by Software B.(d) Name the appropriate test and state, in words, the hypotheses.
(e) State the conditions for the appropriate test, and explain why the conditions are met.

(f) The test statistic for the appropriate test is <math alttext="negative 2.070" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.070</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (remaining minus drifting). Based on the result of the hypothesis test, what conclusion should the manufacturer make? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.3: Representing a Categorical Variable with Tables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
